39075358.review:
THE VIDEOKID is a remake of one of the great classics in the history of gaming, Paperboy, originally from 1985 but made on several platforms over the years. THE VIDEOKID is a runner where you play a kid riding his skateboard delivering video tapes for marked Letter boxes While trying to avoid all sorts of dangerous enemies that mostly are 80ies culture icons like movies/cartoons characters etc. The handling is as simple as it gets as the controls are left and right  and up for jumping while a fourth key is for throwing the video tapes. The game can be played on either keyboard or controller. When colliding with enemies the first time the game ends. The game has 3 different trick updates which in my opinion is a bit limited but still ok as you doesnt have much influence on them anyways. Besides of that different skins can be bought by earning ingame coins.

I think all fans of runners or the original paperboy will be satisfied aquiring this great little game that in my opinion actually is way better than the original and its sequel. The vast ammount of culture references is really staggering and has had me trying to remember what movies and shows they might have appeared in originally.

I bought this game at full price and is really happy that i did so as its a simple but addictive game of nostalgia.

Below is posted different characters ive spotted ingame but be aware if you are a film buff you might want to skip that part as i had a blast myself trying to figure them out.

[spoiler] various characters/things from same shows/movies turning up on different ocasions down the road (who framed roger rabbit, peanuts, dr who, He-Man, baywatch, karate kid, back to the future, teenage mutant ninja turtles,the blues brothers, 48 hours) - characters showing once, Inspector gadget, care bears, a-team, big bird,  duck tales, star trek, scarface, taxi driver, National Lampoon's Vacation, michael jacksons thriller, terminator, paddington bear, dukes of hazard, beverly hills cop, ghost busters, space invaders/Pac-Man, rocky, herbie, dancing prunes, Short Circuit, lethal weapon, super man, Fraggle Rock, Alvin and the Chipmunks, smurfs, postman pat, scoobie-doo, Peabody and Sherman, Indiana jones, transformers, Ruff Mitchell from Dennis the Menace cartoons, flintstones house, Chucky from Child's Play, gremlins, simpsons, Elliot riding bike with E.T, John McClane from Die Hard, Jason Voorhees, Batman car, pee-wee Herman, Freddy kruger, Beetlejuice, Ash Williams from evil dead, platoon, aliens 2 armored car, poltergeist house, The Fall Guys truck, Snake Plissken/Escape from New York, Bill & Ted's Excellent Adventure, Ferris Bueller's Day Off characters in red car, alien rammed down by previously mentioned armored car, nightrider, Giant Stay Puft Marshmallow Man from ghost busters [/spoiler]

and even then im sure i missed a bunch

39018127.review: Surprised this game isn't more popular. Great Paper Boy clone with an 80's theme. Worth the price.

33809438.review:
Et av de bedre spillene jeg har hatt gleden av å prøve i år! Virkelig moro! Det minner ganske mye om gode, gamle Paperboy på Commodore 64, men med bedre spillbarhet og kulere omgivelser. Man har også muligheten til å kjøpe nye karakterer og triks etterhvert som man tjener opp penger. Underveis på ruta (man er ikke avisbud, men VHS-bud!) møter man gamle kjenninger fra 80- og 90-tallet, slik som Skeletor fra Masters of the Universe, Turtles, Pamela Anderson (Baywatch), Onkel Skrue, Terminator og mange flere. Genialt! Man kan også kaste VHS-kassetter på intetanende folk, slik som Homer som mekker på bilen eller en stakkar som holder på å male garasjedøra...

Kort oppsummert synes jeg spillet leverer på alle områder, men skulle virkelig ønske det var flere brett. ;) Nå som spillet er fullført og alle karakterene og triksene er kjøpt, så er det ikke så stort insentiv til å kjøre samme løype mange flere ganger. Håper virkelig det kommer mer av dette altså! :)

Anbefales! Tommel opp!

33383593.review:
Great game, even better if you grew up in the 70-80s. The amount of different characters you recognise that you had forgot about is amazing. They have packed a lot of references in there. I won't name them as half the fun is recognising them and shouting it out. 
The game is an obvious clone of Paperboy but in my opinion it is much better and more fun to play. Plus you don't need a bicycle controller to play it!  I find it easier to play with a controller. Unfortunately the game does not support a controller but I use Pinnacle to get around this. There are only 4 keys anyway so its not really an issue. 
The difficulty level is spot on leading you to the feeling of "Just one more go" and one more go becomes 10 more goes etc... 
Highly recommended at the full price.

33335644.review:
游戏方式很简单就是以前fc上报童的玩法 只不过丢的是录像带

游戏全程不超过4分钟 但是突发事件 不死几次很难规避

游戏汇集了非常的80年代剧集动画游戏 就冲这点就非常让人感兴趣 

游戏中可以和路人互动 砸人 砸玻璃什么的 尤其把homer的千斤顶砸掉 压死homer这段让我百试不腻非常非常有趣

33164537.review: Great fun arcade action. Clearly it's a revamped new-age paperboy clone. But that's ok as I feel it betters it in every way possible. You will find 'constant' nods to all things from the 80's and early 90's here. From cameos of old cartoon and movie characters. To old videogame characters turning up. It's a good laugh. :)

33122187.review: Great game. Both me and my daugher likes this. I remember the old Paperboy game in thje 80's and Videokid is a homage to that game. It is littered with references to pop culture both old and new. My daughter likes it because of this, finding charachters form tv showa she knows. Easy to play but difficult to master.

33025718.review:
A love letter to the 80s. It's basically the game mechanics of Paper Boy (dodge/jump stuff and throw things to mailboxes..) except your character is pretty much a depiction of a skateboarding, vest-wearing Marty Mcfly. If you grew up during the 80s you will recognize many of the characters that waltz by in the background, from Inspector Gadget, Duck Tales, TMNT, He-Man, Peewee Herman, Rocky, Eddie Murphy, etc... each with their own funny sound effects as they pass. The sound effects of the game are a particular standout, and have an appropriately lo-fi sound to them which resembles audio of games back during this era. 

It's a very straightfoward game with limited features, but if you're feeling nostalgic and want a trip down memory lane for the 80s and many of the movies and animated kids' shows of the time, this easily fits the bill.

31258391.review: So, The Videokid, really cool game. Would highly recommend it-- especially for the small price tag. The premise is simple enough and the excecution is done quite well. The game is making you through almost what I would consider a rail arcade game where you have to deliver as many videos as possible while also making your way to your girlfriend. The score attack part of the game keeps you on your toes while the incentive to collect money also for skins and tricks makes sure there is a benchmark for how good you are getting. The design of the level is ingenious, with plenty of nostalgic references to make sure you keep grinning as you go along. The secret level is cool as well. Overall, the game is fantastic, my only knock on it being that the loading times are "too long" for a game that is all about failing and repeating. (Too long as compared to super hexagon that is almost instantaneous).  Appart from that, definately buy it if you get the chance.

30504612.review: This game is just awesome! Simple, but awesome! Old school paperboy remake with a video delivery kid, which makes it even more fun and hilarious! Fun old figures coming around and changes everytime, with different figures at random areas! Just fun to play and get some memories back from the 80's!

30463948.review:
Pour moi le seul et énorme problème que ce jeu possède c’est je trouve complètement hors de budget les prix pratiqués dans la boutique du jeu.

Pour pouvoir acheter un seul perso vous devrez passer des centaines d’heures sûr un tout petit jeu qui devient très répétitif a force. Une bonne partie vous allez gagner  + ou – 3dollars, UN perso va vous couter 250…. Ehhhh

Et des perso il y en a des dizaines. Je ne comprends pas pourquoi ils ont fait ça.
Mais a part ça le jeu est assez fun et on y passe du temps sans même se rendre compte.

Donc je le recommande quand même a tout petit prix tout de même.

30323756.review:
[h1] THE VIDEOKID – весёлый runner от PixelTrip Games [/h1]

THE VIDEOKID была разработана ребятами из PixelTrip Games и была выпущена в Steam 31 января 2017 года. На момент написания обзора на странице Steam обзоры пользователей были Положительными (100% из 12 обзоров). Цена на THE VIDEOKID составляет 2.79$.

[list]

[*] Играть мы будем за подростка-скейтера, который по дороге в парк на свидание с девушкой может развозить газеты и зарабатывать деньги.
Весь геймплей заключается в рандомном runner’e. Весь мир процедурно генерируется во время игры. В игре огромнейшее количество разных отсылок к разным играм. Возможно из-за этого и такое название: «THE VIDEOKID». 
Управление осуществляеться кнопками влево, вправо и space. Перепрыгиваем преграды, обходим пешеходов и автомобили. Всё очень просто.
Так же в игре есть прокачка персонажа, такие как покупка разных образов главного героя и трюки, которые он может выполнять и получать больше очков.

[*] Пиксели, пиксели, пиксели! Вся игра THE VIDEOKID в пикселях. Всё выполнено в фирменном стиле Crossy Road. Игра действительно красивая. 

[/list]

Вердикт: казуальная игра для слабых компьютеров. Подойдёт на вечер-два. Лучше всего подойдёт для путешествий.

29964639.review:
I'm sorry Jessica, I've tried, I really did... but PixelTrip Studios just made things too hard for us, it would never worked out!

Jokes on the side, ladies and gents we have a real indie gem here.
If you were a kid or teenager back in the 80's stop reading here and INSTANT-BUY!

Game itself is very repetitive, but not in a bad way, the kid in you will always push you to try again, and again.
Both graphic and sounds are made nearly to perfection, I really can't say anything negative about it.

Only con I do have are controls, first we aren't able to change them second beside left,right, jump and throw button I really need duck/crouch one! Maybe those TNMNT can manage well in sewers, but I can't, sorry. 

I won't reveal much of gameplay itself not to spoil all juicy stuff in game, but with this price it should be regarded as must buy!

29906515.review:
[h1] The Videokid: [/h1] [i] A throwback to the 80's arcade game which you play as THE VIDEOKID running around in a city full of people and cars running around. 10/10 [/i]

[h1] Story: [/h1]
[i] THE VIDEOKID is an Arcade game in which your goal is to deliver as much Video-Tapes as possible. After you deliver the Video-Tapes while escaping from various obstacles and people trying to stomp you down your skateboard, you got to meet Jessica at the Park, which is actually the most difficult part of the game. Test your reaction skills as you avoid various obstacles in your progress of delivering videotapes and trying to make it to the park. Also featuring Unlockable skins and Powerups! [/i]

[h1] Pros about the game [/h1]
+Very well made scripting, no bugs found yet.
[b] +Low-spec. Despite the Minimum Requirements saying that it requires an i3, 4 GBs of RAM and a GTX 480, this is playable with 60 frames per second in a 200$ computer. [/b]
+Physics do apply in everything in the game, from breakable windows, to cars and trash cans.
[b] +A M A Z I N G ragdolls! You will encounter a diffrent fall in each type of fall you take off your skateboard in-game. [/b]
+Easy obtainable Skins.

[h1] Cons about the game: [/h1]
-No level of difficulty option, we need that.
-Powerups are Overpriced. I understand that it's a Powerup, but they are.

[h1] Personal Opinion [/h1]
I would personally recommend this to anyone who is willing to take a breath out of these AAA+ games and find a good old-school Arcade to just chill out and have fun, but be warned: Gets addictive very fast!

29813501.review: Very enjoyable arcade-style game. What a great idea to bring back Paperboy, and stuff it full of references that gamers of a certain age will appreciate. I couldn't put this game down until I beat it, it's so moreish. I'd thoroughly recommend picking this up, it should definitely be getting much more attention than it is.

29786317.review:
As you skate tossing tapes through windows, hopefully into mailboxes, and dodging traffic like Travis Bickle from Taxi Driver or the cast from DuckTales, you collect points and coins trying to meet up with your girlfriend Jessica in the park. It’s a simple game but hardly an easy one. The characters showing up in the intersections and along the sidewalk that you have to avoid crashing into can become quite distracting. Often, I care more about knocking out all the CareBears than I do moving out of the way of the sedan coming up behind me and killing me.

I find this game infuriating. My best runs are ridiculously short, yet I can’t stop wanting to play. I keep coming back and going again and again. One of the nice things about this is how the developers keep a running tab for you so that no matter how awful you are (as I am) you can still save up enough coin to purchase avatar outfits. Currently, I’m embracing the Marty McFly-ness of the game using “The Slacker” skin. Point is, this little aspect adds just enough to keep you returning to ‘git gud.’

My only negative criticism of the game is that playing on my laptop the keyboard control is hyper-sensitive leading me to crash into more than a few things with surprising force. However, it’s a quibble. Even if we ignored the nostalgia gimmick, this game’s low cost and seemingly endless play makes it enticing and addictive. The Videokid is just fun.

29749951.review:
I'm reviewing this from the couch/controller/in-home streaming point of view because I feel this is the most natural environment for Videokid's kind of game.

Today, in a total 180°, we'll flip the thumb downside up. PixelTrip Studios' latest update vastly improves the game experience with a controller in hand. The game is not overly hard but can still kill you in seconds and the fact you don't have to reach for a mouse to give it another go anymore makes all the difference. The controller support stil doesn't feel 100% "native" but Steam's controller configurator can pick up the slack and make the mouse-driven store and menus navigatable with a pad. If I could only skip the Unity configuration with a launch parameter, the Big Picture experience would be improved even more.

The game itself is a silly fun time waster with a ton of '80s references but what actually draws me in is the fluid gameplay and the fact it reminds me of Paperboy but doesn't make me want to pull my hair out. Added to the bin of games to go back to when you don't have time or energy for anything new or big.

-- 

Initial review for posterity:
[strike]Seems promising but the Unity configuration popup, lingering Game Over screen and the fact you need a mouse to skip the intro and use the menus are seriously killing the pick up (a controller) and play and replay and replay again aspect. I want to enjoy it but the aforementioned clunkiness is getting in the way.[/strike]

29727717.review:
[h1]Video Kid throws in every nostalgic thing you loved about the 80s from the mullets to Fraggle Rock to the friggin’ California Raisins into an 8-bit fast-paced Paperboy-esque gaming experience. Plug in your walkman and lace up your Reebok Pumps, this is a review for The Video Kid.[/h1]

The VideoKid is a fantastic experience coming as an 80s kid myself. I enjoyed the constant references while I dodged, grinded on, and threw tapes into mailboxes. The game starts off simple enough, you have tapes that need to be delivered and you’re the guy to do it. There are other challenges thrown in as well, which makes the gameplay somewhat diverse.

[u]UI[/u]
The UI is clean. You have your cash earned in the top right, distance traveled in the middle and your score to the top right. Bottom left is also a pause button and a close on the right. There is no menu screen, so to adjust the sound, you’d have to either end a level or die where the sound will be at the top of the score page. Also to note, there isn’t a way to set the difficulty either in case you find yourself struggling. Score page shows your score, earned cash, movies delivered, and a way to spend that cash now. 

Cash allows you to buy characters of which you’ll recognize immediately like Ferris Bueller and the Karate Kid as well as additional tricks to help boost your score on your routes. All of it costs money and quite a bit of it for the good stuff of course. So, get to landing sweet tricks on your board and these will be yours in no time.

[u]Gameplay[/u]
The game starts with a goal and a route you’re to take. Unlike Paperboy, you don’t have a limit to videos you carry, you just have to land tricks, dodge obstacles, and throw videos into the red mailboxes. You can also pummel Care Bears, Alvin and the Chipmunks, and dudes who need some chill with tapes that you’ll see on benches. I personally enjoyed hitting the Fraggles myself.

There are also characters wandering the sidewalks and familiar cars on the streets to land tricks on. Hitting targets, certain characters, and getting red mailboxes consistently earns you points as well as landing tricks on cars. Stringing combos can be tricky as the setting needs to be exact for the trick to land. This was quite difficult at times since I found myself initiating the trick and then failing because of an unexpected obstacle or a Dalek.

There’s a lot going on on screen at times and it can sometimes become overwhelming trying to focus on hitting the correct mailboxes while simultaneously trying to dodge Scrooge McDuck and his damn grandkids. The are rewards for distance, a number of correct mailboxes hit in a row, tricks and combos landed as well as targets and coins gathered.

There is also a moment where you see 4 familiar green turtle open the sewers. What happens when you fall in? Yep, you skate the sewers. These little touches make the game slightly more challenging.

However, gameplay can become quite repetitive quickly. And with no way to set difficulty, some may find this game a bit too hard first time around. So, if you find yourself having a bad time, your best bet is to keep trying and work at it until you got it down to a science. Depending on what you’re hoping to achieve, you may find the gameplay lacking with this in mind.

I also found it strange there are no Steam Achievements or Trading Cards to earn for your deeds in-game. Perhaps this may be changed in the future.

[u]Controls[/u]
The game uses WAD to move with A and D for left and W to jump. Spacebar is to throw tapes. The controls are responsive and the Video Kid jukes, jumps and throws videos on cue. Hitting mailboxes can take a few tries to get right, but once you get the mechanic down, it’s relatively simple to hit the mailboxes each time.

There is partial controller support as well if you prefer. Left thumbstick to move and jump, A to throw tapes and Y to jump. I used a wired XBox 360.

[u]Music[/u]
Music is fantastic and by DJ Savant. It’s upbeat enough to keep you interested, but not repetitive to the point you end up focusing more on its annoyance than the game.

[u]Overall[/u]
The Video Kid is a cute blast from the past and I thoroughly enjoyed all the retro references. I definitely feel my age creeping up when I can name pretty much every reference in the game. :) The addictive fast-paced gameplay, the snappy controls on both KnM and controller, awesome flashbacks all work together in tandem in creating a damn good experience and a retro roller coaster. 

If you can look past the lack of a menu to adjust the sound and difficulty as well as the tedium, then Video Kid is definitely one you don’t want to miss.

[u]Pros[/u]
+Simple to pick up, tough to master
+Different characters and moves to unlock
+80s retro vibe and so much nostalgia
+Responsive controls

[u]Cons[/u]
-No menu to adjust settings (Sound, difficulty etc.)
-Gameplay can become frustrating over time, especially if the difficulty is giving you a hard time
-No Steam Achievements or Trading Cards

29627741.review:
[h1]Basic Information[/h1]
[b]Title:[/b]  THE VIDEOKID
[b]Status:[/b]  Released
[b]Developer:[/b]  PixelTrip Studios
[b]Publisher:[/b]  PixelTrip Studios
[b]Genre:[/b]  Arcade
[b]Release Date:[/b]  31st of January, 2017
[b]Type:[/b]  Single-player

[h1]General Impression[/h1]
It’s been a while since I played a decent 3D endless runner, so THE VIDEOKID hit the right spot for me. “Runner” might be a bit of an understatement since you’re actually a skater. This is indeed a cute little title from an indie dev team at the start of their journey onto Steam. As long as you don’t mind the inherent  repetitiveness of this arcade subgenre, you’re good to go. Well, skate.

A trip down Memory Lane indeed, since the main visual diversity offered by this title comes from the multiple film and video game references it alludes, without actually naming them per se. Obviously that is just one of the many caveats imposed by copyright laws. Alas, you shall be able to easily recognize quite a few characters from the ‘80s and early ‘90s. The large pixel visual style is still pleasant on the eyes and the sounds are diversified more than enough.

The gameplay itself is somewhat lacking though. In both depth and the initial presentation. No tutorial (apart from a brief start screen that indicates which buttons to push or when), no cutscene and definitely not a very complex storyline or motivation. You’re the title’s eponymous Videokid. A silent protagonist whose apparent mission is to skillfully throw VHS tapes from a distance, while avoiding the many traffic and sidewalk obstacles that will surely get in the way. And yes, apparently the game’s goal seems to be meeting “Jessica” at the park. Now that’s something easier said than done. In the good ol’ tradition of arcades from the past (which this game really tries to emulate at least in spirit), THE VIDEOKID is hair-raisingly difficult to progress through, let alone master it. I shall not mark this as a weak point simply because I feel that such a game shouldn’t be too easy. It maintains the legacy of coin-hungry arcade machines which both forced players to focus and learn the game’s patterns and at the same gave a real sense of accomplishment for those lucky and skilled few which could best the title and reach an ever impressive highscore.

Most certainly the presence of a difficulty slider would have been welcome. In part, THE VIDEOKID is also hard because of the randomly generated obstacles which offer a new perspective and challenge every time you restart the level. And you will have to do that quite often. Distributive attention and multitasking aren’t unheard of in video games, but in this particular case you will often fail the stage by focusing too much on collecting coins (which help you unlock new outfits and items for your skater) or hitting the red mailboxes with the tapes instead of minding the road and incoming vehicles.

Videokid can aim at many objects and NPCs with grace and doing so is actually encouraged by the scoring system on the upper right side of the screen. You really can’t complain about the pacing but the gameplay itself gets boring eventually. Constantly hitting hurdles and having to restart the entire level, doesn’t help either. At least Unity Engine ensures a smooth and nicely detailed experience. The developer should definitely sweeten the deal by adding Trading Cards and Achievements in a future  update. The price tag is decent but if you’re still not convinced, buy THE VIDEOKID when it shall be inevitably bundled. I’ve decided to recommend the game for its sheer nostalgic value, if nothing more.


[h1]Strong Points[/h1]
+ Old school feel with plenty of pop culture references.
+ Affordable & challenging.

[h1]Weak Points[/h1]
- No Steam Achievements nor Trading Cards.
- Repetitive gameplay.

[b]Rating 60/100[/b]
 
[quote]This review was submitted for [url=http://steamcommunity.com/groups/ImperialReviews]Imperial Reviews[/url] and [url=http://steamcommunity.com/groups/Cubbes]Cubbes[/url], through the generous contribution of [url=http://steamcommunity.com/id/nevenapetar/]ZemunBRE[/url].[/quote]

29621616.review:
Videokid really embodies the spirit of the old arcades that made history. I'm not just talking about the absurd quantity of the coolest references to the classics of every 80's media, but the gameplay as well. It is a challenge, a real challenge. As simple a goal, skating to the end of that road is a feat only a few of us will ever do. Jessica will be waiting at the park for a while, but I'll be damned if I don't get there one day.

That's precisely what attracts me the most in this game, it's nearly unbeatable... NEARLY!

Like in Halliday's Egg Hunt on Ready Player One, there’s a race to see who can put their name first on that score board.

Thanks PixelTrip for creating a game true to the magic of the 80’s.

29619514.review: I love this game, classic, totally chill but intense too.

29615877.review:
[h1]Are you 80s enough?[/h1]

http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=855381776

Between "Love" and "Hate" can be sometimes a big hole or a close line. The Videokid actually is somewhere between that.
Do i love this game? I sure dont love it. Do i hate this game? No, i cant hate it. Is it a good or bad game, well, i explain that in my review for the best...

[h1]Its 7.55! Im Late for Jessica![/h1]
With that last words, Videokid, the player, goes of to his ride down the street of a whole momento of the 80s. The game play is also already a 80s game, which is for sure a really nice clone of [b]"Paperboy"[/b]. That actually makes the game not bad but i come later back to this. As i said already, the street you ride down here is a whole momento of the 80s. Not only more or less [b]known[/b] characters appiers here and there, even more [b]unknown[/b] characters from this timeline appiers. I could name some but since im born in the late 80s, im glad to say [b]-I-[/b] at least know good 80-90% of all the stuff which you will see here ingame

That exactly is the reason you might even fail the [b]first few times[/b]. Insteed of "just ridin´ down the street", you just cant look away if you see suddendly [b]Michael Jackson, Alvin & the Chipmunks, Homer Simpson, Rocky, Scarface, The Fraggles and what not[/b] - just to name some. That makes you kinda giggle and fail a whole lot time, might give you even a flashback of the whole old time (actually, i had to laugh the fuck out of me as i saw some old characters from my childhood here and there). [b]Is that a bad thing?[/b] Actually, no, its not but i can only say that you should be born at least at the early 90s to understand what you actually see and who you see there.

[h1]"LAME, DUDE!"[/h1]
The gameplay itself is really like a 80s arcade game. [b]Its brutal hard but not that hard that you actually cant enjoy it[/b] - but you only have [b]one life.[/b] So if you only hit one thing or touch something, its Game Over. Said again, it [b]IS[/b] hard but not that hard that you actually dont enjoy it. For me, its kinda "ok" in its difficult but since i must look for every character and giggle about the good old times, i really saw my ass crashed a lot times over and over into a car, with a smile in my face X3.

[h1]Do i recomment it?[/h1]
I actually say i [b]do recomment it but with caution.[/b] If youre to young or born maybe in the late 90s, 2000s or younger, you might dont understand a whole lot of the game and might miss the "fun". Next to this, maybe a lot people would rage about "its to difficult" - but since its a "80s styled" game with 80s styled gameplay, those games [b]were hard this time.[/b]

So if you love(d) the 80s or actually are born in the 80s, you sure should play it, there is nothing wrong with it and for the pricetag, its pretty cheap, too.

the [b]ONLY[/b] thing i wish this game will get is that the game gets sound opinions. To much sounds (background, characters, music) is going on and that sometimes....just [b]to much at ones and very very loud[/b]. I hope it will get some more opinions then insteed just "sound off/ sound on". Next to this, just sometimes if you jump+try to move, the controles can be very stiff, might need to fix that too...

But yea, i enjoy this game and having a good time, riding down the street and throwing the Care Bears a VHS in their face...

29615818.review:
Herkese Merhabalar,

Bugün sizlerle birlikte Steam Greenlight’ta yeşil ışık yakılmış oyunlardan biri olan The Videokid’e göz atacağız. 31 Ocak itibariyle oyunculara sunulan oyun PixelTripStudios tarafından geliştirildi. Steam’de 8 TL gibi bir bedeli olan oyun bu yazıyı yazarken %10’luk indirimle 7,20 liraya alınabilir durumda.

Oyunda Videokid adlı karakterimiz ile kız arkadaşımız Jessica ile parkta buluşmaya giderken kırmızı posta kutularına elimizdeki kasetlere atmaya çalışıyoruz. Oyunda Crossy Road gibi sınırsız bir yol bulunmakta, bir yere çarpıp ölene kadar toplayabildiğimiz kadar puanı toplamaya çalışıyoruz. Oyunda aynı zamanda bu korsan kasetleri dağıtırken polislerden de kaçmaya çalışıyoruz.

Oyunun grafiklerine göz attığımızda gözü rahatsız etmeyen pikselli olduğunu görebiliyoruz. Karakterlere de göz attığımızda Minecraft gibi kübik bir halde olduğunu görebiliyoruz. Oyunun seslerine de gelirsek tam 8-bit arcade oyunlar aklıma geldi. Oyunla bütünleşmiş sırıtmayan bir müziğe sahip.

Oynarken topladığımız para sayesinde oyun içindeki mağazadan karakterler satın almamız mümkün.

Oyunun içinde bir çok easter egg bulunmakta. Yolda koşarken film,çizgi film ve oyun karakterleri gibi bir çok tanıdık sima ile karşılaşmamız mümkün. Koşuşturma içerisinde onları görüp tanımak insanın yüzünü gülümsetiyor, eski dostlarla karşılaşmak güzel oldu.

Oyun genel hatlarıyla bu şekilde. Pikselli grafikleri ve ona uygun müziği ile keyifli zaman geçirmemizi sağlayacak oyunu sizlere tavsiye ediyorum.

Bu incelemeyi blogumda okumak için: [url=http://kirmizineptun.xyz/the-videokid-incelemesi/] tıklayınız	[/url]

29611045.review:
The Videokid is an absolute throwback to the 80's.  It's a fun spin on the Paperboy games with a ton of references from the time period and maybe a bit of a Skate or Die feel.  If those all seem somewhat foreign to you then maybe a better comparison would be to modern endless runner style games.  

You take control of a kid on a skateboard who is trying to meet his girl at the park.  But his pesky job of delivering VHS tapes gets in the way.  You skate along and make your deliveries while avoiding various obstacles.  Obstacles that are often references to 80's pop culture.  Maybe you need to avoid the Terminator.  Or peg some Care Bears in the head with a tape.  Drop in a sewer that you saw a few Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles drop into?  You can grind on top of cars and benches in an effort to increase your score.  Make a few extra bucks and you can unlock various characters to use along with some extra moves.  

At the end of the day if you're a fan of the 80's then this might be right up your alley.  Same if you're into endless runner style titles.  If neither of those things really appeal to you then I'd give this a pass. 

If you want to see how it plays with some horrible commentary: 
https://youtu.be/7LGRHS-kfGw

29608911.review:
[h1] «THE VIDEOKID» [/h1] 
Хардкорная, динамичная аркада с героями голливудских блокбастеров.

Цель игры - оставаться как можно дольше живым. Нам также предстоит доставлять пиратские кассеты, выполнять сумасшедшие комбо, объезжать препятствия, избегать полиции. По дороге вы встретите множество знакомых персонажей. Попробуйте узнать любимых героев фильмов, мультфильмов и тв!

Игра выполнена в ретро стиле 80-х с графикой под «Minecraft». Хоть наш герой и квадратный, но он очень пластичный и хорошо анимированный. Вы это заметите по сценам смерти. Он не падает бревном. Умирая он подпрыгивает, катится, барахтается, раскидывает свои маленькие ручки и ножки, «размазывается» по капоту раздавившей его машины. Это очень забавное зрелище.

Вдохновившись 8-битными аркадами для игры создали замечательный саундтрек (DJ Savant) и звуковые эффекты.

Зарабатывайте в игре деньги и открывайте новых персонажей и модернизируйте ваш скейт.

Игра довольно сложная.  Умирать будете часто, ведь у персонажа всего одна жизнь. Да и скорость головокружительная – даже не успеваешь оглядеться. Могли бы добавить выбор уровня сложности или несколько жизней. Не помешали бы и доски почета. Было бы здорово посоревноваться с друзьями. В остальном это отличная аркада в ретро стиле с любимыми героями. Рекомендую!

Геймплей:
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=xrK0BV7f2Bw

29606870.review:
ビデオテープをお届けしながら町中をスケボーを爆走するゲーム。
昔PaperBoyというゲームがあったそうでそれに瓜二つのようです。

版権で色々と問題が発生しそうなキャラクタが次から次へと登場してとてもにぎやか。
正直もはやビデオテープを届ける必要性を感じないのだがそれが良い。
シンプルながら先に進める楽しさがあって、何度もリピートしてしまう良いゲームだと思います。

29605861.review:
Симулятор скейтбордиста в стиле Minecraft. Игра очень быстрая и хардкорная, лично я не прошел и первого уровня, если в ней конечно и есть уровни) Хотя судя по описанию они есть. Ваша задача объезжать препятствия, делать трюки, и собирать монеты для открытия в игре других персонажей. Препятствия, враги и другие персонажи в игре разнообразные, так что игра вам не наскучит однообразностью.

Минусы или что нужно добавить:
- достижения, а почему бы и нет? 
- коллекционные карточки
- сделать игру более легкой, добавить жизней персонажу или уменьшить скорость движения, так как прям с самого начала игры препятствия очень плотные и халявы в игре не ждите)

Любителям хардкора и бешенных скоростей игра придется по вкусу.
